page.title: 15BURNHAM MARKET VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall is the centre for many activities in Burnham market. It is owned by the Charity Commissioners and is run by a management committee. The hall was built with money from grants and local fund-raising and was opened in 1963. It is currently undergoing extensive restoration and redecoration. Regular users of the village hall include the Youth Club, the two local branches of the Women's Institute (Burnham Market Afternoon WI and the Seven Burnhams WI) and the Royal British Legion. It is available for private hire and is often used for discotheques and private parties. Yoga classes take place in the hall weekly, and the Autumn Horticultural Show is held there in November. At election times the hall becomes the village polling station.
